techmeme.title: LA-based Sahara AI, which uses AI to recognize copyrights and track assets, raised a $43M Series A led by Pantera and Polychain, and claims 200K contributors (Saritha Rai/Bloomberg)
Access Now and Citizen Lab: Russian spy agencies are using deep knowledge about opponents, reporters, and human rights groups to target them via phishing emails (Joseph Menn/Washington Post)
Kiteworks, formerly Accellion, which offers secure email and file transfer tools, raised $456M from Insight and Sixth Street Growth at a $1B+ valuation (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
Meta shuts down CrowdTangle, less than three months before the US election, in favor of the Meta Content Library; Mozilla says 50K+ petitioned against the move (Dara Kerr/NPR)
Foxconn says it will only start shipping a small volume of servers with Nvidia's GB200 chips in Q4, before ramping up significantly in Q1 2025 (Bloomberg)
